title: 105_hr905
content: ELIGIBILITY OF UNITED STATES NATIONALS FOR ADVANCED TRAINING IN THE SENIOR RESERVE OFFICERS' TRAINING CORPS. Section 2104(b) of title 10, United States Code, is amended to include provisions for nationals not citizens to become residents of a State and apply for naturalization within a specified timeframe before commencing advanced training in the Senior Reserve Officers' Training Corps. The amendment allows non-citizens to apply for naturalization within 60 days of meeting requirements or being accepted into advanced training. Eligibility of US nationals for financial assistance in Senior Reserve Officers' Training Corps. The General Financial Assistance Program under Section 2107(b) of title 10, United States Code, is amended to include provisions for nationals not citizens of the United States to become residents of a State and apply for naturalization within 60 days. The General Financial Assistance Program under Section 2107(b) of title 10, United States Code is amended to allow nationals, not citizens of the United States, to become residents of a State and apply for naturalization within 60 days of meeting the requirements. The General Financial Assistance Program allows non-US citizens to become residents of a State and apply for naturalization within 60 days of meeting the requirements. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENT. Section 12102(b)(1) of title 10, United States Code, is amended to include eligibility for advanced training or financial assistance in the Senior Reserve Officers' Training Corps for nationals of the United States.
